text:
09.06.2017, sample from a 5l plastic container @ William K:
No head, just some bubbles, nice slightly cloudy reddish golden color. Aroma is slightly sweet yeasty, very ripe banana, yeast, minerals, sap, overripe yellow apples, grass, caramel, bubblegum. Taste is slightly sweet fruity, yeast, fruit stones, minerals, banana, weeds, grass, hay, almond essence, banana peel, sap, bark, sugar. Medium bitterness, slightly harsh yeasty mouthfeel. Fair enough.

500ml PET bottle courtesy of japppp for EU local swap 2/2017, cheers Jussi!murky bright amber-brown with no head. quite sweet and full of esters on the nose. to taste theres spicy grainy notes, a touch of musty oxidation, lots of sweetness and some herbal juniper notes. Quite a lot of clovey yeast phenolics resulting in something a bit like a sweet dunkelhefe. Definitely interesting to try but will reserve judgement on style until i try some other examples - perhaps on draught.

0,75cl PET bb02/2017, sampled 03/2017, merci Mirka! - This one might have slightly turned in transit, but is still drinkable with enough oddness to hold the attention: its landed somewhere between a dusty Weizenbock and a harsh geuze, both pepped behind the scenes of their respective terroir brown bars with a shot of genever. - - Expectedly no-nonsense in the looks dpt, beige dough with lots of UFOs and trub. - Lovely doughy bread flavours and most of that banana sweetness devoured by lacto, not a bad thing overall. Sweet bread, dry heather honey, juniper sneaking in from the back and staying around. The wild dimension here is very shrubby, else hard to place and only partly superseded by the new lacto sourness. Ergo: enjoyed half a bottle, used the other half to spice up & make more vivid beers that were too sweet...Glad to have finally tried this.

330ml bottle from a bottleswap with rosenbergh, thanks a lot!
Extremely strong banana aroma. Ripe bananas turning black. Lots of banana sweetness and some fruity sourness. Very full and filling
Enjoyable, bananas, wheat, and a bit of spices, muddy, without carbonation, High not noticable alcohol.

Plastic bottle, thanks to Jashiu.
Looks like muddy tea, smells like weizen, tastes banana sour, weird but I enjoyed more than expected. Cheers to Finland

ELS 1/17, thanks rosenbergh: quite a nice, brown semi-turbid appearance with some yeast on the bottom of the bottle. Nose is heavy clove phenols and banana-centred esters in a pleasant mixture. Mouthfeel is oily and well carbonated, a litttle too sugar-sweet for my taste. Quite filling and full bodied with a finish of fusel alcohol and isoamylacetate. All in all very pleasant experience if you are looking for phenols, esters and sweetness. I like it.
Bottle, thanks to Jokeri33. Cloudy reddish colour. yeast, fruit, banana aroma. Sweet, yeasy, banana, fruit taste. Medium body.

Plastic bottle from Alko. Pours slight cloudy brown and no head. Taste is very sweet with Christmas herbs, cardamom, cinnamon and cloves. Mouthfeel like a very old barley wine without carbonation. Very strange taste at first but more likeable after a while.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Courtesy of rosenbergh via trade
Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate yeast, apple, fruit, spice/clove, and hints of bubblegum. It pours a cloudy dark orange with a minimal off-white head that is really just a few stray bubbles. The flavor starts moderate fruity yeast and light apple. There are some hints of bubblegum in the middle. The finish has some lightly sour citrus, juniper, and spice/juniper. Its medium bodied with minimal carbonation and almost flat mouthfeel.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2016 At St Urhos pub. Helsinki. Reddish-brown, flat and cloudy. Sweet sugary smell: berries, wood, a touch of soy sauce. The sweetness of the taste is fairly quickly dampened by a fruity-vinegary sour. Notes of rye bread, overripe papaya and crabapple. Finish is flat. I know it is the style but the combination of cold, flat and watery doesnt sit so well in the mouth. The ABV is evident in the finish and aftertaste. Final verdict: it isnt the best drink Im likely to have (even today), but its certainly interesting and overall good.
Duft krydret kant af kanel lidt appelsin smag krydret kanel kant frisk sød lidt krydret julekrydrei

Bottle in Orivesi, Finland, Dough,spices,alcohol and lot of berries, Cloudy orange color, no head, Really sweet in taste, light alcohol notes, Sticky, Almost flat, Full body, Apart of mosquitoes I have enjoyed it. Original brew.
Sample from a plastic bottle. Hazy orange colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of spice, juniper, fruit and malt.

How: Plastic bottle.
Where: Alko.
Appearance: Amber colour with a minimal head.
Aroma: Fruit, malt.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Fruit, malt, alcohol.
Plastic bottle. Pours a hazy orange color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity spicy yeasty aroma. Fruity malty weak sour spicy yeasty flavor. Has a fruity malty weak sour yeasty spicy finish.
What a difference for me between this and the Lammin sahti. I really enjoyed this version. Easy to drink. Definitely has some juniper resin but is much more drinkable. Quite tasty.
Awesome clove taste. Banana. Yeast. Sweet. Watery palette with no carbonation. Usual Sahti.

W aromacie soczysty, wyraźny weizenbock, dojrzały banan i goździk, lekki karmel, bardzo przyjemnie. W smaku już do głosu dochodzi jałowiec, dominuje, nadaje nut leśnych, wyraźny jest też goździk, banany zanikają, piwo staje się lekko ziemiste. Alkohol dobrze ukryty, piwo pijalne i smaczne. Thanks @rosenbergh!

0,75 pet botle Thanks to Hermod (Secret Santa 2015) Bottle was shared.
Appearance: A Unclear amberblonde with hardly a head.
Aroma: Salt, junipers, vegetables funk
Taste: moderate sweet, junipers, vegetables, some grains and funk. 
Average body, allmost no carbonation.

A big "Mahalo" to Rosenbergh (Jan) for dragging this and another dozen or so beers all the way from Finland to Hawaii! A new beer, a new style and a new country for me, the "Trifecta"! Has a sweet, yeasty scent, reminds me of an under-carbonated Belgian Double.A hazy caramel colored beer, nearly flat, no head. Very sweet, fruity with hints of allspice. Flat, like a beer left in a glass overnight. With all the trouble to bring this all the way here, Id love to say that I really liked this beer, but it just isnt my cup of (Sah) tea.
Brown color with very little foam. The smell is sweet and boozy. The taste is fruity (Blackberries) and quite sweet. The oily taste doesnt change a lot in the aftertaste. Oily and fruity sweet beer.

From the bottle, thanks anstei! Hazy deep orange-brownish color with basically no head. Malty aroma, sweet! The juniper berries are there, but not too crazy. Taste is sweet, malty, some juniper. Low carbonation. Nice, but sweet...
UPDATED: DEC 19, 2015 My first sahti, 0,75l bottle. Pours hazy amber. Sweet and bready nose, also present in the taste. Mostly sweet, a bit bitter.
Kyllä sahti parempaa on kuin luulin. Petrin bänditreenituonti. Banaaniliköörimeininki

Bottle at April Tasting in Belgrade. 1L, clear plastic bottle, huge thank you Alberto! Deep red-orange, a couple of bubbles. Big hefeweizen aroma - banana, clove, sweet. Smooth, mild body with definite darker here character. spices, big banana, a little cloying. Some caramel malt lingers. Strangely hefe-like. Well, it was interesting!

Plastic bottle. Frothy White mostly deminsishing head. Amber colour. Light hopy and moderate malty aroma. Strong caramel and toffee notes. MOderate sweet and not bitter flavor. Average light bitter finish. Caramel dominating.
sweet malty aroma,amber, hazy, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice harmonic finish.
Amber coloured and lightly unclear. Has almost no head. Heavy sweet aroma, notes of butter and fruit, banana. Faint smoke too. Flavor is heavy sweet, more banana.

Bottle share at Partizan. Thanks to birthday-boy Paul for my final style tick. Clear plastic bottle, BB Aug 2015. Hazy dark orange, small bubbly white head. Aroma is honey, banana esters, marzipan, concentrated apple, musty solvent, Apple Sourz, toffee. Body is medium, smooth, low carbonation. Taste is apple, toffee, mead, more musty solvent and booze. Pretty sweet, but nice. I wasnt expecting to like sahti this much.
Plastic bottle @ fonefan tasting. No head. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are yeast, banana, fruits, malt and herbs. Sweet finish.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy brown without head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, light butter, yeasty and banana. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet finish. 200615

Plastic bottle shared during Pauls 30th - big thanks to the birthday boy. Pours cloudy amber-gold with a a flimsy white head. The aroma holds sugary bread, cereal grains, clove and banana. Medium to big sweet flavorbwith rich bruised banana, doughy bread, light alcohol. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Sugary finish, oily, with more banana, yeast, phenols, bread, cake, berries. Solid stuff. Sweet but tasty.

Bottle split at P-Arch thanks to Bropey, 20/06/15.
Hazed amber orange with moderate off white spotting. 
Nose is toffee apple, vanilla, fruit rinds, bitter orange.
Taste comprises more toffee apple, light cinnamon, caramel, custard, dark fruits. 
Medium + bodied, soft carbonation, light boost in the close.
Decent
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared by scopey at partizan. Viscous caramel brown. Coloured pour with no head. Aroma is sweet cakey, Apple, apple crumble, marzipan honey . flavour is sticky sweet, thick, cake, light spices. Palate is sweet and sticky, viscous, lowish carbonation. I quite like it.

Plastic bottle shared at Partizan. It pours cloudy orange-amber with a small yellow-white head. The nose is rich, sweet, intoxicating, candy, marzipan, bakewell tart, battenburg, jammy, stewed apple, spice, plastic and candy. The taste is rich, oily, sweet, fruit cake, glazier cherry, raisin, toffee, marzipan, honey cake, toffee and pepper with a sweet, oily finish. Medium+ body, fine carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Rich, sweet and filthy. Solid solid stuff.

Bottle share in Partizan West arch. Thanks to Comrade Scopey. Head is white and thins quickly. Smellls like a good battenburg cake. Marzipan. Tastes marzipan with some roast and fruits. Quite thick and rich. New style and not too shabby.
Bottle, thanks GT2, amber pour, no head, flat, nose and taste are caramel, okay

[ PET Bottle ][ 20oz+ ][ rosenbergh ][ $2 ][ Trade ][ 4.28.15 ]
>> Pours a flatter murky/opaque burnt amber with essentially no foam and little to no carbonation. Nose at first is quite estery with baked apple, dark bread, and browned banana. Hefeweizen came to mind for all that sampled this with me. Taste..at first it was quite sweaty, a tad metallic, and really sweet approaching cloying. Wife picked up a Gin and juniper bite but I did not. Really thought it lacked balanced. Flavors came through of dark bread roll, brown sugar, and brown banana. No fusel alcohol, but abv is apparent while sampling with some obvious warming. As it sahti gets to room temperature, I think the sourness in the finish really comes through. The palate gains an almost rustic, dark Berliner Weisse flavor. Flashes of sour mash grain, lemon, lime. The acid balancing this one out finally. It becomes quite enjoyable. To be honest, I ended up finishing everyones glass because they did not like it, but I really did. Funny, since from the first sip I was not initially impressed. Really fun to try.

Bottle 0.75l at the 7th Belgrade Beer Tasting all together finally.Taste with Alberto, Matt and Vlada.07.04.2015.Thank you Alberto for provide this bottle.Congrats Matt for new style.Pour it very cloudy dark amber color with no head.On the nose Banana.Ciaooooo Alberto Banana haha.Taste and aroma of sweet, liquer but nk alcohol feel,reminds so much in German Hefeweizen. Very interesting to try

PET-flaske 750ml fra Alko Arkadia. Drukket på rom 793 på Hotel Presidentti 6 Mar 2015. Mørk brun. Veldig uklar. Null skum. Vinøs aroma. Plommer & svisker. Smaken er mye ulik frukt. Plommer. Fersken. Mørke druer. Blir kanskje litt ensformig - men et godt og annerledes øl som ga mersmak. Minnet litt om øl jeg fant i bakgatene i Riga for noen år siden.
Bottle 50 CL. Notes of banana, toffee, c, caramel, fruits. Goes down easy. Trololo- beerbasher

Appearance: Murky red-brown with sediments at the bottom of the plastic bottle. Very flat. Not very appealing.
Aroma: Forest, sweet, sour.
Taste: Slight sourness, forest, juniper, sweet, weird! Not sure whether I like this style or not.
Bought: Trade with rosenbergh - thank you very much!, 650 ml
Info: 13/3-2015, BB: 7/4-2015

Orange brownish colour with no head. Aroma has lots of banana, toffee and caramel. Taste is quite the same, banana, sweet malts and toffee. Medium body and not much carbonation. Nice sahti that has something else besides the banana flavour which I find pretty bad in some Sahtis.

Shared bottle at local tasting, from a trade with rosenbergh. Pours hazy deep golden/reddish no head at all. Aroma is light sour/acidic fruits/berries. Taste is weak sweet, more like a vegetable juice, no trace of the alcohol, dangerous easy to drink, weak lingering acidic finish.

Lukt: Syrlige frukter, noe røykesild.
Utseende: Rødgul farge
Skum/kullsyre: Ikke skum.
Smak: Syrlig noe fruktig smak.

Kommentar: Endelig også fått prøve Sahti, takk til Gunnar for å dele denne med oss.

Bottle shared by Ippopotamo36 @ La Tana (Rome), thanks Alberto! Pours an unclear orange color with no foam. Aroma is apricot juice, esters, malt, dirty socks, no good. Flavour is a bit better, sweet, with a little bitter end and some fruity acidic notes. Oily body, no carbonation. Interesting beer, but it could be more refined.
At Pauls. the aroma is banana, spicy, wheat. The appearance is deep amber, white head. The flavor is clove, banana, spicy. The finish is spicy, sweet. Medium in body. Odd, like a here in some ways.
Pours out of a plastic bottle , unclear amberblonde . Smell is salty , vegetables , funk . Taste is salty , funky plastic aspects , some grains .
UPDATED: FEB 27, 2015 Bottle thanks to Janne. Pours orange brown. Nose/taste of herbal juniper, fruity bread, bubblegum, tree bark, orange peel. Medium body. Interesting. Easy drinking.
Bottle - Light malts and some caramel notes. Cloudy copper with almost no head. Sweet, herbal, grains and a sweet finish. Very odd. Doesnt seem like any alcohol at all. Not sure it is my thing.

(Plastic) bottle brought to me by Jokso the Fin, shared in Rome with Mortalach and other fellows at la Tana pub. Thank you Jokso. Pours a vivid and hazy amber-orange color with a practically no-head if we leave some bubbling phenomena while pouring. Oily body. The nose is sweet maltiness, banana, grounded ginger. Mouth: unfermented beer most, sweet milled malts infusion, juniper background. I did not expect it could have been drinkable. A more than decent non-beer. Finland on!

Bottle at home thanks to VastActiv. A murky amber beer that has quite lifeless pour. Nose is banana bread and toffee. Tastes of banana bread (something I love by the way), toffee, hint of juniper (not as strong as I would have thought), light plums, touch of cough medicine. Very different palate but smooth, sweet, with lingering finish. Ill need more experience to truly judge this puppy.
Draught at WilliamK. Amber color, white head. Bittersweet taste with citrus, banana, wheat, malts and toffee. Bitter finish with citrus, toffee, banana and grass. Nice sahti.
Bottle (at Craigs I would have assumed). Pours murky amber, funky smell, sickly sweet taste.

Plastic bottle from Secret Santa - thanks! Pours cloudy burnt umber, no head, no lacing. Aroma is banana, clove, a touch of smokiness, pine/spruce. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter, hefe like banana esters, pine sap, something a little odd and unfortunately fecal. Medium body, no real carbonation. Interesting...
Orange brown, no foam. Basically a dunkelweizen in all characteristics: banana, clove. Not sure what a sahti is supposed to be, to be honest.

0,75 L bottle from rosenbergh. Thanks Jan, Ive always wanted to try a sahti straight from Finland. Sweet, banana, slight honey, and a touch of juniper berry in the aromas. Sticky banana, alcohol, yeasty esters, spices in the flavors. Interesting.

Served from somewhere at St Urhos Pub, Helsinki. Hazy dark copper with nought but a few bubbles on top. Interesting aroma with chocolate, port and blackberries. Oddly plasticky too. I try to describe the taste with words like minty, earthy, moss, chocolate, honey, but none of those really capture it. Certainly very unique and I look forward to trying the strong version.

750 ml bottle
Clear mahogany colored beer with no head. Aroma has fruit candyish banana and yogurt. Flavor is tart, and fruity sweet with strawberry and banana.Full and soft palate. Long aftertaste with alcohol and banana. A clean sahti.
Dark brown, no foam. Ripe fruits, ripe banana, sweet bread and salty sea air on the nose. Flat carbonation, silky soft mouth feel. Sweet bread, caramel, banana and juniper flavors.
Bottle from Alko. A cloudy amber colour with a small white head. An aroma of caramel, alcohol, banana and butter scotch. The taste is heavy sweet and light bitter.
Ambrée trouble, pas deffervescence ni de mousse. Malts clairs, notes de bananes, un peu dacétone. Une infection.

Bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Pours murky brown with no head at all. Aroma is heavily sweet and spicy; banana, toffee, juniper berries appear. Taste is very sweet and slightly sour in the finish. Banana is accompanied by yeasty spiciness and some berries. The palate is medium bodied, a bit sticky and flat, deceptive to drink. Tasty speciality, stronger version is slightly richer in taste and body.

A really nice cloudy amber pour with no head. Not much carbonation, that probably explain the vanished head. I dont have much experience with Sahti, but they are probably like this. Not much head on The Gotlandsdricku I had at Gotland either. Nice inviting aroma. Reminding me of an German Hefe weisse. Lots of banana and very fruity. Almost full body and slightly sweet. Low bitterness and an oily texture. The flavor is also full of banana. Fruity, some spices and mild citrus in the back. Some acidity also, it actually makes it a bit fresher. I really enjoy this one. And makes me want to go back to Gotland this summer. Anyway this one is far better than a lot of the Gotlandsdricku I have had down there.[Plastic bottle with a twist cap from a trade with Rosenbergh. Thannxxx a lot!]

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2016 19-JUN-216. From a plastic canister at St. Urho Pub, Helsinki. (8,50!? Fuck!). Quite sweet, too sweet actually - caramel and sweet dark bread. Spicy cloves or band aid and just a kiss of nail Polish remover that makes it feel even more spicy. Flat, no head. Farmhouse-ish, maybe too much.  5-2-6-3-12=2,8/5.


24-APR-2014. PET 75CL from rosenbergh. Thanks, Jan!

Look: very cloudy amber with a humble off-white head.
Aroma: lots of esters, fruits, acetone, green apple astringency, a bit catty.
Taste: juicy, fruity, the sweetness is balanced by some nice acidity, green apple bitterness/astringency. Quite unique and very rough, with a young and unwieldy homemade character. 6-3-7-3-14=3,3/5.

Plastic bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Thanks tomer! Pours orange to brown with no head, aroma of Juniper, malt, spices, flavor is fruity like apricot, Juniper, vinegar, medium bodied.

Bottle from Jan, thanks!
Hazy orange.
Aroma has bubblegum, banana and tooth paste.
Taste is yeasty and tart, Reminds a lot of "mäsk". 
Full body, no carbonation.
Interesting and also reminds me of old "brewing" sins.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Thanks tomer. Cloudy, orange. Juicy, rotten fruit, some olives and seaweed aroma, very sour, pungent taste that also bears some sweetness. Full-bodied, sour finish.

At a tasting, many thanks rosenbergh, extremely hazy deep orange to light amber colour, aroma of saurkraut, vinegar and some spiciness coming through slowly, flavour of pineapple and canned fruits, assertive fruity sourness and a hint of bitterness. Very interesting and really easy to drink for an 8% brew, could be addictive.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2015 Re-rate 10/15: Plastic bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks troubles. Sweet. Lots of overripe fruity esters, rye, a juiniper note. Nice.
7/3/7/3/14=3.4

Plastic bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Thanks tomer! Murky amber-brown. Sourish aroma of vinegar, sauerkraut, cookies, a bit of spiciness, yeast and some funk. Sourish flavor, a bit vinegary, with a bit of sweetness, a bit spicy, with overripe fruits and yeast and a slightly astringent finish. Medium-bodied, a bit sticky. Nice and interesting. 7/3/7/3/15=3.5

Thanks to erzengel for sharing!! Pours a hazy orangish brown with a small very loose tan head. The smell is fruit, sweet malt, caramel, bread, spice. The taste is a blend of the aforementioned flavors ending dry and crisp. Medium body and a bit slick with very mild carbonation. Overall, certainly an interesting beer with a ton of flavor though a bit sweet for me.

Thanks to Rosenbergh for my 2nd Sahti - 75cl plastic bottle. 
Reddish-brown in the glass, slightly cloudy. Nose is beside the nice smooth and yeasty malt somehow herbal medicine-like, but no hint of sourness. Even a little cane-sugar aroma is there. The Sahti starts mild, low in carbonation. The juniper is quite tasty in the mainpart, fresh herbal notes beside the maltyness and the nice clove from the bakers-yeast (!). It even has something from a fresh yeast-dough. Very interesting. The aftertaste is smooth, slightly herbal, malty, no hint of the 8%. On the tongue remains a very nice herbal, dough-yeasty note. No bitterness at all.  --> Also a great and very interesting brew! I like it! --> 13/13/13/13

75cl bottle from a trade with rosenbergh. Thanks a lot Jan! A real beast I got here. Color is dark copper. Almost no head. Body is thin. Taste is medium bitter and sour. Light salty. Aroma is caramel, brett, cellar, fruits, spices, alcohol, grapes and wine. This is really interesting.

A dark brown colour, basicly a not head at all. The nose of sweet malts, some dark bread, bananas and spices with some yeast. Taste is sweet, spices and lots of bananas. The end is slightly drying with balanced spices, some warming alcohol without taste. Almost full bodied without carbonation, very smooth and slippery to drink that is enhanced to nonexistent carbonation. Balancy sweetness and easy sahti, but still enough of character.
UPDATED: FEB 26, 2016 Kyllä sahti parempaa on kuin luulin. Petrin bänditreenituonti. Banaaniliköörimeininki.

Bottle, 75cl - Unclear amber red beer with no head. Aroma is fruity with notes of pears, honey, juniper, alcohol, yeast and some glue. Flavor is fruity sour with notes of pears, juniper, hay, bananas and mango. Very special beverage, not sure if this perhaps needed to be fresher.

Shelf life till 30.9.2013. 75 cl, plastic bottle. Pours cloudy rust with no head. Aroma: Toffee, malt, hints of juniper. Taste: Sweet, mild bitterness. Some yeast. Palate: Medium body, creamy. Good and balanced.

Bottle pours brown orange-ish, hazy with no head. Aroma is banana, juniper, pines and yeast. Much more malty than hoppy. Flavour is banana, juniper, yeast, a bit of sweet and a bit of alcohol. No carbonation. Full, oily texture.
Gedronken @ RBESG 13 Grand Tasting, Plastic flesje, oranje kleur, niet helder, ruikt en smaakt fruitig, zoet, weinig koolzuur, aardbei
Bottle @ RBESG. Aroma is very sweet caramel, almost candy and medicinal like, some molasses, liquorice and spices. Flavour is tangy, fryuity, candy like of red fruits. Interesting.

Reddish brown colour, white head. Aroma of candy, bubblegum and yeast. Quite sweet flavour, malts, strawberry, wood and green grass. Rather sweet finish, apple and malts. Nice and original beer!
(From 75cL plastic bottle shared @ RBESG 2013 Grand Tasting, Bodegraven. With thanks to tiong for sending me this in the Local Beer Swap - Euro edition)
Bottle. Deep amber a bit hazy beer with a white head. Malty and very sweet aroma. Malty, sweet and fruity flavour.

Sampled this plastic bottled monster @ RBESG 13 Grand Tasting. Hazy orange colour with no head. Smells lots of herbs, sweet, spices and somewhat alcoholic. Tastes sweet, lots of herbs and spices and some alcohol. Full body, soft carbo. Meh.

(bottle, huge thanks to tinus for sharing!) pours a murky deep amber colour with a frothy white head. aroma of herbal hops, marzipan, heavy chestnut honey, brown sugar and lime. flavour is gooseberries and sugar icing, with a heavy sweetness, a hint of alcohol and a light-bitter finish. heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.

75 cl. clear plasti PET bottle (yes!) @ RBESG 2013. Thx! to Martinus. My first Sahti. Murky amber with almost no head. Nose is sweet malts, sugar, caramel, brown honey and some toffee. Taste is sweet, brown sugar, candy sugar, sweet caramel, fruits, sweet spices, quite sweet. Slightly sticky malts & honey body. Really surprised how sweet this was, I didnt expect Sahti to be sweet. Quite liked it, nice to try finally a Sahti.

Plastic bottle at RBESG 13 Grand Tasting. Murky amber colour, off-white head. Aroma is sweet, red apples, cake, glue, juniper. Flavour is sweet, glue, juniper, sweet ripe fruits, light berry bitterness in the finish. Medium-bodied.
Bottle at RBESG 13 Grand Tasting. Pours hazy dark orange with a small white head. Aroma of spices, sweet, some strawberry. Taste is sweet and fruity with a soft bitterness. Too sweet for me.

Plastic bottle @ RBESG 2013 Grand Tasting. Aroma of glue, sweet strawberry candy. Hint of caramel sweetness, bit fruity. Taste is actually way better than the aroma, but once you get used to the aroma the strawberry becomes more prominent than the glue. Maybe they shouldnt have bottled it in plastic?

Plastic bottle at the RBESG 2013 Grand Tasting. Poured a cloudy orange with a round white head and bags of broken lace. The flavour is medium sweet with lots of citrus fruit and malt. It has a slightly oily texture and is a little chewy. Nice to taste, but not for a session.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2013 Pet Bottle @ RBESG13 Grand Tasting @ De Molen: Served in a Molen taster: Thanks for sharing Tinus:
Some creamy white bubbles on top of a hazy darker orange colored beer.
Aromas of fruits, wood, sweet wood, spices, herbs, orange, peach, sweets.
Flavour is sweet fruits like peach, apricot with sugars, some marezpin, candy sweets, malts and some wood.
Aftertate is sweet alcohol drenched peach with candy sweets.
Low carbo, soft creamy mouthfeel, medium body, creamy texture
Quite sweet but bot unbalanced.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Sample at rbesg 2013.
Thin white head. Hazy amber pour. Nice enough brew. Nothing special
Bottle @ RBESG grand tasting. Hazy orange color, small white head. Smell and taste some sweetness, some fruits (juniper berries?) and lightly alcohol. Average body and carbonation.
Plastic fles. Mooi donkerbruin bier. Aardig schuim. Ruikt iets naar kauwgomballen. Chemisch zoet.
Pours an orange beer out of a plastic bottle. Not inviting. Doesnt smell nice. Smells like strong liquor. Doesnt taste like beer. Very sweet.

Plastic bottle. Its my first (real) experience with this traditional Finnish brew. Maybe the few sips in childhood dont count... Rusty hazy copper color with no head. Sweet aroma of honey, mead and lemon. Sugary taste with a little unusual bitterness. Alcohol in finish. Tastes like a strong bock with low carbonation.
Bottle. Reddish amber. Overripe bananas on nose, a bit of darker malts also (not roasted, but more ryeish). Body is full, sweet. Brown bananas, rye. Not the best, but a good sahti.-- bb/h(n9)

From a jug at St Urhos Pub. Still body, lightly murky brown body, no visible signs of carbonation. strong browned banana wort aroma as if I were smelling a three-day fermented Dubbel. Medium body, chewy caramel syrup, medium bittterness, some noticeable higher alcohols (paint thinner). Watery finish. Nothing interesting or intriguing here, Im sorry to say

bottle @ home. profumi di lieviti, banana e con senori aciduli di fermentazione. praticamente senza schiuma, non ha carbonatazione. al palato è poco consistente, un po appiccicosa al palato e alla lingua e con finale acidulo piuttosto astringente. ha punte dolciastre , carente di luppolo e intensamente acida, soprattutto nel retrogusto.

Kaatuu lasiin ruskeankeltaisena ja sameana, täysin vaahdottomana. Haju on vahvan banaaninen ja katajainen, maltaisuuden haistaa myös helposti. Maku on todella alkoholin polttama jo kylmänä, banaaninen, katajainen sekä rukiinen. Suutuntuma on keskitäyteläinen ja erittäin hiilihappoinen. Kokonaisuutena erilainen ja jopa hämmentävä kokemus (toinen sahtikertani), alkoholisuus häiritsi elämystä.

Bottled. Pours light brown in color with very thin bubbly head. Notes of smoke, wood,leather and juniper in aroma. Lovely. Sweet, ripe banana in taste mostly. Some hints of that smoke and wood also appears in flavor. Oily. Chewy mouthfeel. Sweet, fruity banana mash in aftertaste. Nice, but the stronger version of this same sahti is a bit better.

750ml bottle (shared by FatPhil, thank you). Dark red, cherry stone color. Sweet, bready, some smokiness and massive banana in aroma. Yeasty, banana, bit of dead yeast bitterness in flavor. Very smooth and silky. Warmth of alcohol in every sip. Its upgraded version of Estonians farmhouse beer and I like it.
Glass from Gallows Bird, Espoo. Colour is hazy brown with small white head. Aroma and flavours are banana, toffee, sweetness and malts. Quite like "weizenbock"

75 cl bottle.
Pours pretty hazy mahogany color with a minimal head. Aroma of yeast, some spices, mild juniper, a bit of banana on the background but not too much, some herbal notes as well. Flavor of caramel, yeast, some mild spices and faint ripe fruit notes. Some mild alcohol burn at the end. Slick palate with a mild spicy finish. Nice balanced sahti.
4325
Pours cloudy dark orange. Aroma is banana, yeast, pine. Flavor is alcohol and over cooked fruits almost rotten. Bitter palate.

Bit strange aroma has bubblegum, alcohol,dark caramel, spices, juniper, banana and clove (bit like dark wheat beer in that). Not bad..just unique. Colour is clear brown with a hint of red. No head and no lacing. Taste has sweet malt with bit bitterness and bubblegum. Not sure what juniper tastes like..maybe it is there..should be at least. Light bodied, no carbonation, sweet and bitter, slick. Well..this has been interesting. Would really like to taste one made by some local crazy-man...who has been making it for years..to him and his buddies mostly...deep in the woods. This was ok anyway.
Pours hazy golden with no head, as expected and clearly visible from the see through bottle. Aroma juniper and a hint of banana. No carbonation. Traditional nice Sahti. Not Bad.

23rd December 2009A bottle in the Rake - provided by and shared with MagicDave - Cheers Tom! Cloudy amber beer. Honey - fruit nose. Softish semi dry palate. Sweet malt - hints of juniper and a little bubblegum. Zero carbonation but its as smooth as a babys arse! Sweet and smooth. Whats not to like?

.5 PET bottle via rosenbergh...many thanks.  While the PET is great for shipping and eliminates the potential for shattered boittles of broken dreams they are hit and miss with carbonation.  This was a pretty bottle mind you.  I could only find a slight neck ring of heavy plastic.  Cap was solid, Label appliacation dead on.  Base, panel and top weights seemed within spec....oh crap, Ive reverted to my old days at the bottle factory....AHHHHHHHH!  Yes dear readers, I know.  A fair amount of trub in the feet of the bottle... A gentle pour yields a honey amber that is still slightly hazy.  Unfortunatly as I alluded to above, the beer was still.  This fact did subtract from the total score.  First taste was taken with some trepidation since most still beers turn out to be absolute swill.  This was not the case with this brew.  Clove and banana in nose an body.  finish was led by sweet lemon cookie citrus.  8% was not noticable.  Caramel malts abounded.  Carbonation would have made this a great beer.  Hmmm....how can I accomplish that?
UPDATED: FEB 10, 2013 Bottle from rosenbergh, kiitos. Hazy brown color with no head. Aroma of banana, peaches, honey. Taste, banana, honey, wheat, yeast, junipers. Alcohol is quite well hidden. Good.

Courtesy of Armando629, many thanks! Poured hazy with an amber color and a minimal, off-white lacing foam. Banana, bubblegum, honey, peach, grapes and apple in the delicious aroma. Dense body with flat carbonation. Fruity, sweet finish. A unique, excellent brew.

Courtesy of Balázs, thanks!
Olyan színe van, mint egy barackos ice teának, ami szűretlensége miatt nem igazán átlátható. Habja... őőő, az nincs, legfeljebb pár buborékfüzér helyettesíti. Édeskés illata van, ami barackos, kissé teás és borókás. Íze igen gyümölcsös, barack lekváros, borókabogyós, gyümölcsteás és édeskés. Sűrű teste van és egyáltalán nincs benne szénsav. Utóíze gyümölcsös rágós, édeskés és tealeveles. Nagyon érdekes egy ital, ami egyáltalán nem sörszerű, de mégis finom.

Trade with Rosenberg, thanks!
Cloudy-hazy amber appearance, mnimal froathy head. Fruity aroma, caramel, tee leaves, some lurking juniper. Oily body, minimal carbonation, peach and pach jam, tea again. Interesting juniper and fruity flavors.
Some people say its really good. Im not one of them. (This beer rating was imported from FB and unfortunately lacks any further comments.)

75 cl plastic bottle, rated on 9.8.2008
Aroma has banana and hints of alcohol. Flavour has also some artifical-like banana. Very oily palate, but also a bit floury. Too sweet for me and the alcohol also disturbs here.

Süßer, angenehm hopfiger Geruch, minimal honigartig und bananig. Wenig CO2. Sehr fruchtig würziger und süßer Antrunkt, der sich dermaßen würzig fortsetzt. Dabei ist ein scharfer Unterton präsent. Süß, fruchtig, etwas bananig, langer Nachgeschmack. Der Alkohol ist nur daran erkennbar, dass einem angenehm warm wird. Weiterhin süß und mild, sehr würzig im Nachgeschmack. 	 
Test vom 30.5.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: -,11,11,13,8,12 - 11,61

On draft at a bar in Helsinki.  Poured a cloudy dirty brown with no head.  Both aroma and flavor are just extreme banana, overpowering anything else.  Interesting to try a traditional ale like this but not really a beer to my taste. (Rated 2011/04/23)

750 ml bottle. BBE 14.3.2011.
Pours a beautiful amber colour with a minimal head. Aroma of sweet banana and bread. Sweet fruity flavour of banana and malts with some alcohol. Medium bodied with a slick mouthfeel without any carbonation. Warming finish. Good one.

Glass from...out the back, St Urhos Pub, Helsinki. Murky brown with copper edges and a brief bubbled rim. Huge banana confectionary and yoghurt aroma. Full slippery mouthfeel like a concentrate of a dunkelweizen, big banana yoghurt notes, hints of mouldering red apple, clove, TCP splashes. Hints of warm/fermented reindeer milk, lightly chilled. In my mind. Bananas and custard Muller Light is most accurate flavour descriptor. Too hardcore for Octo. Top stuff.

750ml bottle, parasta Ennen 14.03.2011, vuoden olut 2003, picked up at Alko Arkadia. Naked surface. Near-clear, brownish body colour. Smell of dried fruits, grass and herbs. The flavour is dry and sweet with apricot, ripe banana, spices and sweet, grainy malts. Flat and sweet, but ok in smaller portions. A tad better than the strong one (hotel room, Helsinki 04.02.2011).

Plastic bottle (trade with Jukkabro - much thanks).  Honey banana malt, vanilla, and clove aroma.  Cloudy orange-brown color with no appreciable head.  Sweet ripe banana/light orange, bitter clove and mild malt flavor.  Slight alcohol finish.  (best by 11.03.2011).   One of my biggest wants.   Not disappointed - very similar to a fresh weizen thats heavy on the spices.

(Poured from a jug at Gallows Bird Kekri 10) This sahti looked as it shoud: brown and cloudy without any proper head formation. The aroma had a lot of diacetyl. This was the first time I sensed it in sahti. The diacetyl almost drowned the juniper aroma. The taste had diacetyl as well but fortunately the other flavours: juniper, malts, chocolate, banana and bitterness, could be tasted, too. The score is quite low because of the diacetyl. Deserves a re-rate.

75cl bottle from Alko. Poured red/brown color with no head. No carbonation. Aroma is intense, banana and some sweet/sour aroma. Flavor is banana and sweet fruity with some alcohol bite. Too sweet for me, otherwise a nice sahti.

#1001 RB and first Sahti :-), from Alko Marihamn åland, cons 2010-09-12, Göteborg
AR: banana soft sweetie, soft yeastiness (mmm...), even more palpable after beeing poured!
AP: cloudy amber body, with poisonous looking fermentation, wee transparent head
F: banana, yeast, dry like flour sensation, no carbonation, comment best for date had just pased i guess it didnt effected the flavor at all. And I treated well after being picked up at the Alkos refrigerator it has been cold all the time. Even during the boat/car trip home from Åland.

Murky, brown like dark honey. Does not smell too good. Not a typical beer smell, some what like something after expiration date. Taste is good, lots reisins. Some banana type aroma. Sweet, very sweet. Hops are completely gone, ilke you would expect. And no bitterness at all. Children friendly beer, and you cant even taste alcohol.

Hazy brown with no head.

It was the first time I drank a genuine Finnish Sahti. It was fortunate that we were four who shared the bottle bought at Alko in Arkadia Helsinki, which was at 0.75 cl because the drink was very sweet. The taste and aroma reminded a lot about witbier and wheat beer, spices and bananas. No carbonation, not balanced, a strange beverage that it was fun trying.

Hazy brown color, no head; slightly bananish, sweetish aroma with alcohol coming through; flavor is sweetish and quite bananish, alcohol is also present as quite sharp cutting the sweetness off a bit and leaving a cool sensation in the mouth; quite full-bodied, virtually no carbonation.

A glass from a plastic canister :D @ St. Urhos Pub, Helsinki. Poured a murky dark red colour with pretty much no head. Lovely creamy, slightly grainy yoghurty nose.. the graininess reminded me a little if just a little of a quality bohemian pilsner. Fruity.  The taste is obviously sweet but not too much in my opinion,  fruity and yoghurty, starts getting notes of bubblegum before a strong ginger-like spiciness takes over, burning a little. Ends bitterish and dry. Maybe its just in its prime but it certainly is different, genuine and lovely.

Pours hazy brown with no head. Aroma is mostly bananas, even more so than in weizenbiers. Flavor has very strong bananas too and some yeast. Practically no carbonation at all, which is a big minus since it feels more like a juice.

750 ml plastic bottle. Finland.
Murky dark brown colour with no head.
Very sweet banana, baking soda and caramel in aroma.
Sweet caramel, yeast, some sugar, banana and some alcohol in flavour. Quite heavy but sweet sahti. I prefer crispier (Joutsa/Heinola) sahti. 
No carbonation.

Bottle. Hazy brown, no head. Malty aroma with notes of yeast and rye. The flavour is sweet, malt, rye, banana and yeast, a hint of smoke in the finish. Medium-bodied and low carbonation. Very good sahti.

Bottle, thank you Patrik!! Bright deep coral red-orange, flat appearance, some particles, a little cloudy, totally unique looking. Aroma is absolutely the fruits at the bottom of sangria. Very intense, sour, vinous, complex with alcohol apparent. Palate is flat. Never tried anything like this in my life. Has a primitive and rustic feel that I like. Has strawberries, wine-soaked fruit salad, especially banana. Has a surprisingly dry finish. Really tasty, interesting, and surprisingly drinkable!

Plastic bottle. 
Pours a hazy orange brown color with no head. 
Aroma is yeast, sweet banana with a sour note. 
Flavour is banana bread like with yeast and some spices. 
Interesting but not one you drink loads of.

Bottled. Murky chestnut, basically no head.  Nose is baking yeast, little rye, faint smokiness, old sweet banana and syrupiness.  A bit unclean flavor with messy yeast, rotten banana, little wood, syrupy nuttiness and clear alcohol burn. Mellow sticky palate, low carbonation. Too murky, but works alright as a sauna brew.
Tasted 6/1/07 Helsinki, Finland. .75 cl bottle, iced tea appearance, no head, sweet musty malt aroma, strong flavor of sweet alcohol fruit.

Plastic bottle. Brown-orange color. Hazy. Nice complex smell of honey and gin. Light body and big taste make this beer unbalanced. Fruity and spicy taste. Almost no carbonation. A sip of this beer is interesting, but i cant imagine myself drinking a whole bottle.

Cloudy, orange, no head. Sweet, fruity sour, orange, hint of smoke. Very soft, light acid burning in you throat. Flavorful, easy going.

750 ml plastic bottle. Cloudy orange-brown colour, no head. Sweet aroma of banana, yeast and juniper. The flavour is sweet, fruity and spicy. Alcohol warmth and some smokiness in the finish. Medium-bodied, a little oily, very low carbonation.
Draught. Bready and spicy aroma. Cloudy dark brown colour, no head. The flavour is quite sweet and clovey, gets more sourish, and then sweet and yeasty again. Low carbonation.

"Bottled. Big thanks to Baggio for this one. Cloudy reddish brown with non-existent head. Fruity aroma of banana, herbs and mild juniper with notes of raw yeast and alcohol. Full-bodied with strong notes of cloves, banana and ryebread. Low bitterness in the long fruity warming finish of cloves, banana, spices and alcohol.

Cloudy and murky looking beer that tastes pretty refreshing considering the ABV. Sweet caramelly aroma with banana like notes. Rye, banana and clove in the taste among other things I can’t put my finger on yet, ending with a smoky note. I love it but couldn’t drink this very often. A nice speciality among finnish beers and with the stronger version the most readily available one here.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2008 No head, hazy brown color. Strong, yeasty, banana-like aroma. Very traditionally Sahti-like. Balanced, heavy, earthy flavor. Even some dirt. Very flat easy palate. No surprises as a whole but a very well done Sahti. Try it.

plastic bottle 0,75l 6,62 from Alko
EXP 14.09.2008
Color:amber hazy
Taste:after swirl phenolic, banana fudge and dash of junipertoo,no carbonation at all. Once again difficult to find taste of alcohol. I visited on brewery few years ago with beersociety FatPhil & Anna. Nice place!

Thanks to jjpm74.  Poured a hazed orange-amber color.  Aroma of banana and spices with a sweet malt base.  Mild alcohol in the nose.  The flavor was tart and mildly spiced with a light dry finish.  Different for sure.

750mL plastic bottle, courtesy of jjpm74.  Thanks, John!  Pours a murky, orange-amber color; golden edges; predominantly headless.  Solid amounts of juniper, pine needles / pineyness, and saltiness in the aroma; some alcoholic warmth coming through.  Slightly tart, salty mouthfeel: medium-to-full presence, brown sugars and chewy dried caramel (similar to oxidation, but not); very odd, toasted and salty presence in the mouth; neat, slightly muddled, warming stuff.  Medium finish: dried caramel, brown sugar, and toasty malts; some saltiness and husks.

Draught 0,5l at Metro Lahti (sahtiviikot). Black brown no carbonation no head. VERY HEAVY stuff this is full bodied if something. a bit medicine like. banana. super sweet syrup. Gets you drunk for sure if youre able to drink all half liter.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2008 Bottle from ALKO. At last my first taste of sahti. Rather muddy light brown body and absent head. Zero carbonation from my plastic bottle. Smells reminiscent of some abbey beers Ive had before, with a noticeable amount of neat alcohol coming through. Dominated by phenolic and banana tastes from the bakers yeast, mixed with booze and sweet berries. Only ever want to imagine the hangover this would cause if I drank the whole bottle.
Bottled. Hazy brown colour, minor to non exstini white head. The aroma is sweet with fruits and  juniper berries. The flavour is sweet of malt and fruits. Interesting.

Pours a deep amber-brown hue, very cloudy from the lack of filtering.  Still, but a light iced-tea froth builds up on the top.  As with its bigger sibling theres lots of banana and clove in the aroma, but this one is a touch softer overall with no notable alcohol to my nose.  Waves of cotton candy, juniper and light smoke run across the aroma, followed by plums, tannins, butterscotch and caramel.  The butterscotch-diacetyl aroma strengthens with warmth.  Also, a strong honey-waxy element comes into its own.  The flavour begins very sweet, a touch smoky and heavily fruity (bananas, peaches) and transitions to a slightly drier and still fruity, smoky finish with a light dose of warming alcohol.  Medium-full body with a slick texture and no carbonation.  Bananas, butterscotch, juniper and smoke linger long into the finish.  Interesting just like the strong sahti, perhaps a little more drinkable, still nothing that truly resonates with me.

75 cl bottle, bbe 25.02.08.

Cloudy amber with a creamy white head. Aroma of white chocolate, candy banana, orange and nutmeg. Maybe some crusty bread too. Truly weird. Fullish body, shows some solvent alcohols, honey and stonefruit, next a wave of tannins, banana and pineapple come through... Its so incredibly complex in the way the flavours come through, without being overly enjoyable to drink because the waves of flavour feel disjointed and reflect classic brewing errors. The finish shows more alcohol and sherry and some residual sweetness. Thanks pat for this one, Ive got nothing to compare this to... its just wacky.

Hazy reddish brown. Fruity and spicy aroma. Juniper? Flavor is sweet, liquorice and fruityness are there. Maybe also some vanilla. Im not sure yet whether I love it or hate it... At least its different.

RB#2800: 75 cl bottle, thanks to Grovlam. Pours hazy orange with a bubbly white head leaving a nice lacework. Malty and diacetyl aroma. Solid juniper aroma too. Sweet spiced flavour, much like the Sahti Strong but not as alcohol heavy. Banana fruity, almost like a wheat beer. Ends with a lingering fruit note and light bitterness. Thanks a lot Morten, very interesting experience of a rare style.

Bottle. [thank you, Grovlam]
Pours a dark brown red with practically no head. Looks very much like its stronger sibling. Aroma though, is rather fruity, lots of banana and spices. Okay mouthfeel. Flavour is fine, more balanced than the stronger version. Light sweetness, caramel and fruityness (banana).
Bottle. Hazy golden red-brown colour. Sweet caramel juniper aroma. Quite sweet juniper, spiced bitter candy flavour. Sweet spiced finish. Thanks Grovlam.
[Courtesy of Grovlam, session @ yespr]Red amber with no head. Aroma is  sweet with plums and berries. Flavor is very sweet with notes of  plums, banana and berries.

Bottle [Thanks to Harri for bring it back from Finland] Small fizzy white head that mostly diminished. Spare lacework. Muddy amber colour. Aroma of fruit, banana, berries, caramel, wheat. This might be more complex in the aroma then the 10 %. Over the palate spicy banana, wheat, and mixed fruit. Medium bodied with a soft carbonation. Moderated sweet flavour with light acidic. Fruit and banana like finish.

Bottle 0.75 l. Hazy reddish brown, no head (nor carb). Nose has strong vanilla, stir fried banana, alcohol, yeast. Flavor is strong vanilla, nuts, yeast, smoke and juniper. Pretty interesting. Still, no matter how bluenwhite-eyed I try to taste this, I cant say I really enjoyed it. You propably have to grow into this.
(on bottle) Aroma as a chewinggum. Fruity taste as in; apple/pear/bananna. Would never ever had put this to a 8% ale. Actually a nice, fruity finish.

rbesg06, bottle i picked up in turku, after some fruitless attempts to find sahti in some small finnish towns. anyways, reminded me a lot of a weizenbock, some vanilla and banana, quite weet but with some faint fruity tartness. hazy amber. tasty stuff

RBSG 07 Minneapolis Grand Tasting: Hazy orange, light head, no lacing. Nose of sweet squash, citrus and spice. The flavor is tart and sour, bile and very little bitterness. Subtle and balanced, very beerish. Floral, nutty, good.
Hazy amber of color - no head. An aroma with smokey notes, notes of oak, caramel and spice. A flavor of sweet malt, caramel, raw malt notes and a dry finish.

A huge thanks to Tbone_, for sending this white 75 cl bottle! Banana, citrus, milk and glue in the aroma. Banana flavor with mint, citrus, milk, yeast and juniper. Twigs. Citryus aftertaste. Full bodied. I have never tasted something like this, but it is a very likeable brew.

Bottle...  RBSG 07... Murky golden ale with a miniscule, fizzy white head. The aroma is citric and earthy with notes of lemon, pear and damp wood. Suggestions of honey, Twix®, juniper and mild smoke.  Very sweet in flavor, but the acidity wins out in the long run. Medium-bodied and creamy with moderate carbonation. Lengthy, medium sour, dry finish. That pungency hangs around until my palate is cleansed with cheese and bread. A big THANKS to Boboski for bringing the bottle to Minnesota!

Orange/yellow in the glass, but in the bottle it is amber?  Very hazy.  Interesting sour front.  Bubblegum, citrus, spice, good sour palate.  Not overly carbonated.  Really interesting.  I really appreciated the opportunity to try this.

I have wanted to try this for a long time.  I finally had the chance at RBSG 2007.  Bright orange color, it looks like orange juice.  I wasnt sure it was even beer from across the room, but maybe some sort of fruit-liqueur. Aroma is mildly sour and herbal.  Flavor is is lightly sour again, nothing like a lambic, but only a little sour.  Some fruit here has well, quite tart, balanced by sugar.  I did not pick up any juniper.   Very enjoyable and great palate, I could drink a lot of this.  I did think the alcohol was much lower.

Pat kindly gave me a good amount out of this bottle with tom. I had not sampled sahti since the low lands gathering 2 yrs ago. A amazingly interesting beer! A golden amber colour with a very slight white head. A very herbal and perfumed aroma with hints of juniper berries, elderberry gooseberries and yeast.  Sweet and ripe summer fruits with lillies and some tart gooseberry and lychee.  Alcohol is well balanced although pat says it was too strong for the normal version. light carbonation. Strange but very interesting.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2007 700ml Bottle.
Note - this is the same brew as the Finlandia Strong sahti, they are simply tapped at different points.
Excellent, canonical, sahti, slightly less punch than the strong version.

Botte, thanks to Pat (oh6gdx) for trading! Hazy, muddy amber body.  Off-white frothy head.  Nice coloured.  Aroma of hops, flowers, perfume, liquor.  Nice complexity in the aroma.  Moderately sweet, lightly bitter.  Well balanced and ok complexity.  Quite sweet, but still ok.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2009 Bottle.Unclear medium amber orange color with virtually none head. Aroma is sweet banana, bubble gum, juniper berry. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.  6-3-5-3-11 
Bottle 75cl.[ Courtesy of oh6gdx ]. Unclear medium orange color with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, moderate yeasty, banana - clove, juniper. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is creamy - oily, carbonation is flat. [20090619]  7-3-7-3-14

Big thanks to Degarth for bringing this cool Finish beer with the metal twist off top. It has a hazy cloudy dull un-ripe orange pour with off white head. A not so subtle vanilla aroma is easily noticeable just after twisting off the cap. Once in the glass I get tart and yeasty aromas. Theres fruity tartness, sweet sugar covered peaches and prunes, streaks of vanilla and a hint of alcohol. The taste starts off fizzy on the tongue. Wow, lots of flavors going on. Initially theres a tart grape flavor followed by sweet prunes and sugar coated peaches. Toward the finish the tart grape note returns to accompany a dull yeast funk. Very interesting taste.

Recieved in a trade with oh6gdx. This poured with a cloudy dark orange and and a small off white head. The aroma has some bananas, pears and caramel. There is also a hint of bologna, thanks Paul. The taste has some sweet cherries and a little bit of funk at first. However as you drink a little more, you get lemon bread, bananas and a little bit of nectarines. There is also a hint of clove. Almost like this was fermented with hefe yeast. This was certainly interesting.
Od taste of all kind things, if this is a ale it is a ale gone wild, a lot of diacetyl,

Courtesy  of oh6gdx.  Pours brown and still.  Smells of bananas, lots of spices and juniper.  Tastes earthy with lots of great winterberry and banana qualities.  I really wish this one was available here and that I could be more descriptive on this one.  I definitely would like to revisit both of these a few more times.  Hopefuly that will become a reality.

[Bottle from Beermouth tasted with the hop-bros at Jess cosy inn.]

A beautiful look, that invites to a flavor with similar notes, but it cannot stand the expectations. Aroma is fruitsweet in the sourway, a little. Flavor falls down with ordinary notelevels, but indeed a nice Finland experience. Hard to find out of!

Hazy yellow/copper like with orange/reddish hue and no head. Lots of prune, apple, banana, apricot, cinnamon and clows. I could really use some more carbonation to balance  with the intens sweetness. Almost like chewing gum.

(Bottle BB 19/01/07) Banana and woody (juniper) and slightly yeasty aroma. Orange brown colour, murky, couple of large bubbles (not really a head) and faint lacing. Sweet, banana, juniper, and yeasty flavour with some strawberry hints. Flat carbonated (which is traditional for sahtis), sticky and medium-bodied palate with a hint of alcohol (after warming a bit). Very good traditional Finnish sahti! 30/12/06

Bottle at RBESG 2006. Works better for me than the stronger version (Finlandia Strong Sahti). Subtler and more like an unusual dunkel weiss. Also extra points for the fact that I didnt get sick, despite every Finn we asked about where to get this beer saying that we would.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2009 No head, just a coarse white ring around the edge. Deep dark hazy brown body. Sweetish, smoky, floral aroma reminiscent of roses with notes of berries. Somewhat unbalanced. Sweet watery taste of flowers and earth, strongly spicy, with notes of cardamom and licorice. Complex and interesting, but somehow it makes me feel sick. I’m giving it a poor rating here, but that may simply be because something in it happens to disagree violently with me in a way it might not with others. (0.33l bottle. Rated again 2009-03, with same results.)

Pours with almost no foam. Looks like brown oil in the glass, and thats what it feels like as well; its sticky as hell! It has fresh aroma, some smoke and tar in it. A long, bitter aftertaste of berries accompanies the flavour. Nice.

[Sampled at RGESG 2006]
Deep golden and hazy.
A bit fruity, soursih flavour with clove.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2006 (Bottle) Pours hazy orange. Sweet and spicy aroma with ripe bananas and some marzipan/allmond paste. Honey sweet and stale flavour with ripe bananas and some orange. Sickening mouthfeel.

(Bottle on RBESG 2006) Bottle from 2003 . Shady orange color, small white head. Sweet chewing gum and candy scent. Sour taste with a little bit sweet after taste. Taste a bit like puke. If I could get negative score on taste, I would, perhaps around negative 8...
Dark orange, thin bubbly head. Aroma from juniper, broen sugar and candy. Really sugary and sweet. Spicy finish.
[bottle at RBESG] Aroma is bready, biscuity malt, some caramel sweetness. estery fruit, banana and some strawberry, slightly grainy and cereal like, a little house character. full body, tart finish.
Raw funk runs a riot with a grated bree head and smothers in with juniper. Banana runs the show in the with but takes the raw cheesiness with him.
Hazy orange color. Malty aroma. A bit strange malty flavor, fruity from apples, banana notes.

Shortlived yellowish foam on totally hazy, muddy orange-brown liquid. 
 Woody nose with an onslaught of fruity acids, fresh fruit on vinegar, higher alcohols and dry chocolate powder.  Later on, it gets like chocolate-covered banana. Complex is way too timid for this.
 Strange combination of chocolate, banana, orange and orangepeel, with a bit of oats thrown into. What Im missing is juniper. But its impressive enough. Theres both sweet and sour, but no noteworthy bitterness.
Wry MF, astringent even, sourburn; medium bodied and quite slick, even kinda viscous. 
Whatever way one may look at it, even this industrial  Sahti (C.i.T.?) is a real special. Im humbled.
Thank you, lachesis!

bottled shared by DarkElf!  Thanks!!  Pours a cloudy rich red/orange color with a very small and rapidly disappating head.  aroma is bitter but enjoyable with grassy hints like a saison.  Wow, strong nectar, very bitter peach-like flavors with a rich and slightly drying palate.  Slight grass/hop hint in the flavor as well.  Slight bitter apricot hints come through as the end.  Thanks again Stephen!!

Pours wtih a cloudy amber-orange body topped by a thin head with a good amount of lacing.  The aroma is slighlty sweet yet bitter withnotes of licorice, apricot, spice and a touch of citrus and yeast.  The flavor is sweet with a touch of tartness and a hint of spice, as well as, some yeast and apricot.  Medium bodied and crisp yet slightly warming.

(750ml bottle, with big thanks to my neighbour Erja !) Hazy orange-amber colour with a very short creamy layer. Sweet and fruity (banana, pears) aroma, yeasty and slightly lactic with cloves. Sweet flavour, medium to full body, very smooth carbonated mouthfeel. Sweet wheaty and fruity (banana) taste with a quite strong but not unpleasant alcoholic note; slightly woody fruity and yeasty finish with cloves and sweet chestnut-puree in the aftertaste. Reminds me of a good and complex Weizenbock. Very interesting and tasty brew.

Thanks, Juha! I actually had the beer once before in Helsinki. Went all over the city looking for it. Some had never heard of Sahti before. One store said you only get it in the country side up north. I think I liked it much better this time around. Sweet yeasty nose, ruddy hazy color, fizzy low head. Yeasty, apricots, banana. Pine end, cloves too. Rich, complex, like a hyper-hefeweizen in Germany. Thick. Bizarre, really. Big. Excellent.

Bottle (shared with MoritzF, thanks!) Hazy, orangey to amber coploured, thin foamy layer; strong fruity aroma (bananas, yeast, cloves) mixed with caramel and wood; strong sweet fruity flavour, full bodied; mild, swee fruity finish with a touch of sweet chestnuts. Very well hidden alcohol. A quite strange - in a positive sense - brew..........

Thanks so much Juha - what a nice treat! Nice deep amper color, small patches on the top. A bit meaty and smokey also woody nose. Intense banana inkling, yeast and cloves are following with a very intense bay aftertaste. As it warms up the ripe banana and juniper taste are getting more detectable and intense. Thick texture. Nice!
Bottle - sampled at the RBESP 2005Marzipan wheatbeerish aroma. Wheaty bas-flavor, marzipan, some juniper. Medium to light body. Vanilla and herb aftertaste.

Bottle, at RBESG grand tasting, August 2005. This was my first ever sahti and I wasnt quite sure what to expect. Hazy amber colour. The aroma is very sweet but also seemed to have some hoppy qualities, which is odd. Some tropical fruit in the very flowery and perfumed flavour. Interesting, but just too sweet for me. Rather cloying.

Served ice cold in a Bordeaux Riedel glass. This very original brew has a very hazy dark orange-amberish color with a slight beige-yellowish fluffy head. The aroma is very youghurt like. You can notice hints of white cheese, ripe apricots, fermenting apple cider, some barnyard accents, wet wood, green bananas, fruit yoghurt, Alp flowers and a nice selection of herbs. The taste is refreshing and has a nice caracter. It has touches of lactic sournes, some outspoken fruit mash hints, as in the smell very yoghurt like, again some fine bitterish green banana hints and a well integrated alcohol boost. I think i realy like this style of beer. A very BIG thanks goes to Juha for sending me this most outstanding beers. Thanks my friend !!!

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2005 (750 ml bottle: Obtained in trade with bogdi1, thanks Juha!, and shared with SDbruboy) This is easily one of the most incredible treats Ive experienced since I began rating beer twelve years ago.  Not only because this is wonderfully delicious, but also because tasting a traditional Sahti is a brand new experience for me, and its such a rare treat to get to taste this on this side of the Atlantic.  Ive tasted an American beer that is inspired by Sahti (Southampton Juhlia) but while that Southampton beer is very tasty, its quite different from what Juha has sent me from Finland.  Understanding that freshness is of the utmost importance with this style, I must point out that Juha bought this bottle immediately prior to mailing it to me, it took at most a week to arrive, and its being consumed another week later, so this bottle cant be more than three weeks old.  I cant speak the language, but I see "Parasta Ennen: 13 -11-" on the label, so Im making the assumption that this should be consumed by, well, TODAY!  Woohoo!  Anyway, pouring this into a tulip glass, its dark orange-amber in color and very cloudy, and a small half-inch off-white head forms within a few seconds.  I took my first sniff and initially thought "Saison", but I quickly realized that this is much closer to a German Hefeweizen, but with a twist.  It shows an amazing aroma of sweet, ripe banana and spices that seem close to clove and nutmeg to me, but there is also a pleasant sour aroma to balance out the sweetness.  Very aromatic indeed, unique, savory, I can just keep sniffing my Sahti all night.  Continuing on with this delectable Finnish gift, the flavor shows similar characteristics, lots of sweet banana and bubblegum, plenty of spice, but the citrus and green apple tartness is more apparent on the tongue than in the nose, easily balancing the sweetness.  The sweet banana tends to fade a bit toward the finish, and while the spices hold steady, the tartness exerts a bit of muscle, showing some dominance in the finish.  I also get a slight smokiness in the finish after awhile.  So not only does the tartness balance the sweetness, it keeps the palate refreshed.  Body seems about medium "plus" to me, but again, the tartness seems to help lighten the body somewhat.  Carbonation is good and theres a bit of zest and tang on the palate as well.  Though the head settles to a filmy layer, there is plenty of patchy and spotty lacing scattered all over the glass.  Sadly, Ive come to the end of this session as I only have an ounce left in my glass, and then finally pouring the liquidy sediment into my glass, hoping for another taste, this is now amazingly sour, wow!  Its sad how Im trying to savor this, preserve the last remaining drops for as long as possible, knowing it will be quite a long time before I get to partake in this wonderful Finnish beverage again, and hopefully its a matter of when, not if.  Thank you, Juha, once again for sending this to me, you will forever be a friend.

750 ml bottle, shared by DarkElf, thanks Stephen!  Pours hazy dark amber with a small off-white head that leaves sptty lacing.  Aroma is dominated by sweet, ripe banana and a bit of spice - this smells much like a strong, rich German style hefeweizen.  Flavor is also sweet and fruity with banana up front and then turning somewhat sour as the sweetness fades into tart fruits  Full body, smooth mouthfeel and mildly carbonated.  Quite nice!

Sweet, woody aroma with some yeastiness.  Opaque browned copper body is still and somewhat viscous and oily looking.  Very sweet, woody, floral flavour with strong cakelike yeast.  Medium body with smooth, sticky texture and no carbonation.  I think I like it, but would love to try some more to be sure.  Bottle sampled at RBESG 2005.
RBESG 2005, cloudy amber colour with almost no head. Sweet spicy aroma and flavor. Banana sweet finish.

Ya, ya, I know, its irresponsible to review this style, especially having been shipped across the Atlantic and given that this is a style that is a definite "must consume fresh". Oh well, I want to share my thoughts on the beer, so Im going to. Sampled this bottle courtesy of my friend Juha over in Finland, at Candace and Todds wedding party on 9/24/2005.
Pours a rather cloudy (you cant get this beer to become clear, no matter how long it sits, we tried), but yet bright, orange-yellow, medium-large sized bubbles breaking to the surface, lazily, here and there. Smattering of white bubbles on the edges, and some wispy foam on top that disippates almost immediately. There is some sparse lacing, more like sticky liquid coating down the glass than actual white foam. Aroma has the lovely sour, vinegar-like acidity, rotten pears and peaches, light woodiness and moss, with a hint of vanilla, spoiled tangerines and of course the huge shot of juniper spiciness (tartness, really). Lightly funky, a touch of cheesiness and really quite inviting to yours truly.
The beer poured at the top of the bottle was quite bright flavored, still very vinegary/sour and full of juniper and light cheese, but the flavors go well with a light, moderately sweet, not-quite-caramel flavor, a bit of light bready/doughiness and some lemon sugar cookies. But then its quickly back to the sour citric elements, strong vinegar and almost wet, oily cedarwood like notes. Mouthfeel is fairly loose, with large bubbles giving it a fairly broken feel; this is no tightly carbonated gueuze. But no matter, it does not seem watery or thin, just lightly bubbly and a little loose on the edges.
At the bottom of the bottle its a different story, mixing in the MASSIVE amount of sediment, which can not be helped. Muddy, completely opaque and very challenging in appearance, the beer takes on not what I would have expected (a dull, blander quality), a massively more sour, bitter and astringent flavor. Yikes! This is some seriously sour stuff at the end and makes yours truly cringe after finishing it. Oily, highly sour/tart. Like biting in to unripened juniper berries, perhaps. Still, there is a lightly bittersweet flavor that somehow allows me to enjoy it.
Very interesting stuff, I enjoyed it more than the Strong Sahti, to be honest.
Bottle. A bit more bareable than the strong version. This is still quite sweet and sticky, with a clovey character, and lots of banana esters. Perhaps a touch to sweet for me.
Bottle. Hazy amber colour with no head. Light sweet herbal spicy aroma and taste, almost hefe-weisse like but then not. Medium body and a sweet finish.
RBESG05: Bubblegum, vanilla and spice in nose. Cloudy gold with no head. Sweet honey, spicey notes. Grainy, medium full bodied. Quite interesting.

(RBESG05, bottle) Cloudy amber body with minimal off-white head.  Aroma is medium sweet, fruity (berry, some melon), light herbal.  Taste is moderately sweet, berry, some melon, light herbal.  No carbonation, medium body.

Bottle. RBESG -05. 
Light cloudy amber. Very estery with notes of banana, juniper and minerals. Weissbier feel with a weird body. Sweet-ish with residual sugars.

(Bottle 75 cl) Very unclear amber colour, no head and almost no carbonation either. Lots of wheat esters, I sense banana and other fruits. Honey notes as well. This isnt really that different from its stronger brother. 120805

Bottle, RBESG 2005, Grand Tasting. ABV was 8.1%. Hazy brown colour, no carbonation. Interesting aroma of bread yeast, brown sugar, rye bread, fermenting fruits and pigshed(!). Flavour is sweet and fruity and rather alcoholic. Hints of juniper berries.

An unclear orange beer with a thin white head. The aroma is cloying sweet with notes of wheat, alcohol, and caramel. The flavor is also cloying sweet and again with notes of wheat and caramel. Im glad I only had to sample this - it must be one of the sweetest beers Ive ever tasted, which was just too much for me.

Bottle at RBESG Grand Tasting 05. Aroma as for Finlandia strong Sahti, but with some bubblegum. This is a lighter and easier to drink experience than its big brother. Good range of flavour, but for the most part Im feeling the nectary silk. Better.

Bottled at RBESG 2005.
Hazy orange coloured with a small head.
Smoked aroma with some sweetness and notes of wood.
Sweet flavour of smoke and wood.
Interesting.
Bottle @ RBESG2005. Heavy sweet nose. Hazy orange beer, small white head. Quite weird and sweet flavor. The strong version was better i think, but still a quite funny beer.

Bottled. Hazy dark brown colour, no head. Banana and other fruit in aroma. Flavour of banana, malt and alcohol. Alcohol is the most present of all. Sticky palate. Strong flavour which stays through the following couple of beers too...
Very sweet and fruity and a strong flavor of toffee. This beer is actually more like candy than beer. Warning: Next beer will also taste like this, no matter what it is.

keg @ Helsinki Beer Festival, Helsinki Finland Backlog 2 April, 2005Sahti of the festival. Sweet aroma with a touch of cloudberry. Refreshing (at this strengh!) and slightly smokey. A bit buttery too. Quite complex but still clean and well balanced in an odd way. My favourite sahti!

hazy amber with frothy sticky head. sweet-smelling aroma, some tartness but a strong taffy presence.  lots of wheatiness, and lots of spice which must be juniper.  despite the sweetness, it is quite dry.  warming alcohol; very interesting.  thanks to juha for this rare bottle!

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2014 Bottle conditioned (BB 07/2004)
Dark hazy orange amber color. No head. Smokey strong banana flavor. Dry but sweetish palate: banana, juniper and alcohol dominate the flavor. Aftertaste is warm and this gives a dry mouthfeel. (7/2/3/2/8 2.2)
Re-rate:
after keeping half empty bottle in the fridge two days, sweet banana flavor came up and palate got more balanced, so those ratings came up a bit. (7/2/5/3/11 2.8)
The beer of the year in HBF 1999 and 2003.
Re-rate at brewery. 
Since the earlier ratings this has changed location and brewer. I have had it few times on tap. Now extremely drinkable. Banana with nice juniper spiceyness in balance.

Very cloudy and red colored beer without any foam. Strong banana aroma and maybe some alcohol in aroma later too. Flavour is very sweet and fruity with full and very malty body. Lots of banana and some apple can be found. I miss some carbonation and hops, but maybe then it wouldnt be sahti anymore... Even this sahti has slightly warm ending, cant wait to taste stronger version thats waiting in fridge.

hazy red-amber colour, almost no foam, apple, moisture and herbal aroma with smokey notes, very sweet and oily with a finishing acidity, bubblegum-like finish with a warming alcohol touch, a bit disgusting - original and hard to rate
Cloudy copper color. Sweet herbal aroma, sugary, apples, candies. Sweet, malty, with a clean apple fruitness; finishes a bit herbal. A strange and positive experience.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2007 (Bottled, 0.75l) Almost opaque, dark reddish amber with practically no head. Sweet, very banana-estery, grainy-rye-malty aroma with vegetables, some yeast and alcohol, plus a hint of smokiness. Sweet and malty, strongly bananaish, grainy and ryeish flavor with dried fruit and some ashy smokiness in the finish. Quite well-hidden alcohol. Medium-bodied, rough (particles) palate with flat carbonation. A pleasant and balanced, easily drinkable sahti.
(Bottled, 0,75l, was 7-4-6-3-14=3.4) Nice, muddy red/amber color with no head. Strong and sweet banana/strawberry aroma. Sweet (but not quite "Lammin-sweet"), fruity banana flavor. Quite thick, oily and sticky, a bit alcoholic, non-carbonated, medium-bodied palate. A well-made sahti, and a nice variation to ones regular beer diet.

Compared to Lammin Sahti, this is much less sweet and somewhat tart.  Truckloads of juniper berries and some weizenbock flavors (and aromas) make this an interesting treat.  Virtually no carbonation, which is a bummer.  Murky and brown, with tons of yeast sediment visible.

My first Sahti, and so i have no possibility to compare, but this is really good stuff.  Brown-orange brilliant color. No head, no carbonation. Strong sweet banana aroma and taste, alcoholic. Tastes very similar to a "Weizenbock".

Red and brown in color, cloudy. Almoust no head. Juniper and a bit of banana in nose. Taste is a bit alcoholic, sweet, juniper like, no carponation. Pretty full body and malty also. Aftertaste is heavy and full, also long. Much better than too sweet Lammin Sahti.

Traditional Finnish rye beer. Very cloudy, sweeter than the original versions, low to none carbonation. Has banana and clove flavours originating from being fermented with ordinary baking yeast. Very interesting!
uck

Deep chestnut colour; Heavy juniper nose, with malt and blackcurrant.  Sweet, with loads of juniper, and some really cool malt flavours (this example contains no rye) - slightly toasty-toffeeish but always in the background.  Bubblegum notes show up late. Typical sahti kick.
